body.p: The ∏ virtual image is a platform-independent file that contains an "image" of your working environment. It is delivered as the file visual.im in the image directory of the standard distribution.

During the process of development, you may save "snapshots" of the image file — as many as you wish —, which may be resumed later. Multiple images may be run concurrently (each one maintains its own log of changes), though in practice you generally work with just one.

imagesaveTo save the currently running image, select File → Save As... in the Launcher window. A dialog prompts you for the name of the image, with the current image name as the default. To save the image to a different file, keeping the previously saved image safe, enter a new name, without the ".im" extension. If you choose a new name, ∏ will create a new changes file.

garbage collectionimagegarbage collectTo invoke the compacting garbage collector, select System → Collect Garbage in the Launcher window. This will reclaim any unused data, sweeping all of the object memory except the zone called Perm Space.
To invoke the global garbage collector, select System → Collect All Garbage in the Launcher window. This will reclaim any unused data, sweeping all of the object memory including Perm Space.

exit VisualWorksTo end a ∏ development session, select File → Exit ∏... in the Launcher window. A dialog prompts you to save the image before exiting. If you choose to save the image, you may provide a new filename.
Note that closing the Launcher window, for example by clicking the windowâ€™s close icon, allows you to either exit ∏, or simply close the Launcher window itself.

imageperm save asPerm Save AsUse File → Perm Save As... in the Launcher window to create an image file with all Old Space objects moved into the zone called Perm Space. The newly-created image will execute subsequent garbage collections more efficiently.
This is commonly a last step performed to prepare an image for deployment.
